properties.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Bighorn Mountains West
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 5 at 5:09AM MST until February 7 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Another round of snow will impact western and northern Wyoming
this evening through Friday...

.A series of weather systems will be moving into northwest
Wyoming this afternoon, producing another round of significant
snow. The snow will begin first in northwest Wyoming before
spreading across western and northern Wyoming. Moderate to heavy
snow will continue through Friday, with the heaviest snowfall
Thursday afternoon and night.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to
16 inches possible with the highest totals over the northern
half of the Bighorn Range. Wind over exposed ridges and open
areas will blow at 30 to 50 mph.

* WHERE...Bighorn Mountains West and Bighorn Mountains Southeast.

* WHEN...From this evening through Friday morning.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible over
Granite Pass and Powder River Pass. Areas of blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING
